metadata.name: 11.4.b Number of pedestrians and cyclists killed or seriously injured in road traffic accidents in a built-up area per 100 thous. population
metadata.priority: Building a sustainable, publicly accessible, safe and affordable transport system, especially through the development and prioritization of public transport
metadata.definition: Number of pedestrians and cyclists killed or seriously injured in a road accident in a built-up area per year, per 100 thous. total population.
metadata.methodology: A road traffic accident is an event connected with the movement of vehicles on public roads as a result of which death or injury of person occurred.  A road traffic accident fatality is understood as a person who died (as a result of injuries incurred) at the scene of the accident or within the course of 30 days.  A seriously injured person is a person who has suffered a loss of health in the form of: a) loss of sight,  hearing, speech,  fertility, other severe disability, severe incurable disease or long-term disease that is life-threatening, permanent mental illness, total or significant inability to work in the profession, in a permanent significant disfigurement or distortion of the body; b) other injuries causing bodily harm or health disruption lasting longer than 7 days.  To the built-up and urbanized area (based on geodesic area of the country according to the directions of use) belong the following areas: – residential, – industrial, – other built-up, – urban undeveloped, – recreation and leisure, – transport (road, rail and others), – fossil land.
